elements.description:
`api-request-editor`
A request editor that builds the UI based on [AMF](https://github.com/mulesoft/amf/) model.

The fors are generated automatically based on endponit's definition.

Set AMF json/ld model to `amfModel` property. It accepts the generated
API specification model (first element is a shape of
`http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#Document` type).

To build request editor view for an endpoint, set `selected`
property to an id of an operation that is defined in the spec. The
element looks up for the definition and applied to the editors.

This element is to replace deprecated `advanced-rest-client/raml-request-editor`.

## Changes in version 2

- XHR element is not included in the element. Use
`advanced-rest-client/xhr-simple-request` in your application or handle
`api-request` custom event to make a request
- The element does not include any polyfills
- `redirectUrl` is now `redirectUri`
- `api-console-request` event is now `api-request` event
- `api-console-response` event is now `api-response` event
- Added more details to `api-request` custom event (comparing to
`api-console-request`)
- The user is able to enable/disable query parameters and headers. Set
`allow-disable-params` attribute to enable this behavior.
- The user is able to add custom query parameters or headers.
Set `allow-custom` attribute to enable this behavior.
- From authorization panel changes:
 - `auth-settings-changed` custom event is stopped from bubbling.
 Listen for `authorization-settings-changed` event instead.
- From auth-method-oauth2 changes:
 - Added `deliveryMethod` and `deliveryName` properties to the
 `detail.setting` object.
- From auth-method-oauth1 changes:
 - Crypto library is no longer included into the element. Use
 `advanced-rest-client/cryptojs-lib` component to include the library
 if your project doesn't use crypto libraries already.

## api-request event

Dispatched when "send" button is pressed by the user and the element passes
validation.
The application should handle the event and make the connection to remote
server using passed parameters. When the response is ready the application
must inform the elements about the response by dispatching `api-response`
custom event.

Note that if you set `eventsTarget` property the event must be dispatched
at most on `eventsTarget` node (or any child node).

API components has `advanced-rest-client/xhr-simple-request` element to
handle `api-request` and `abort-api-request` events and to use XHR to
make the connection. Note that it may not always work if the API does not
allows CORS.

The api-request event has the following properties:

- url (`String`) - Endpoint full and final url. Note that if the API does
not specify base uri and `baseUri` property is not set then the `url`
can be relative url to the resource.
- method (`String`) - HTTP method. User cannot change this value, it is
encoded in the endpoint description
- headers (`String`) - valid HTTP headers string
- payload (`String|FormData|File|Blob|undefined`) - Request body
- id (`String`) - A unique request identifier. This ID has to be
  reported back by `api-response` event. It is generated when `execute()`
  function is called.
- auth (`Object|undefined`) - Current authorization settings received
  from the authorization panel.
  In case of basic, oauth 1 and oauth 2 authorizations, the token is
  applied to the headers or query parameters so no action is required.
- authType (`String|undefined`) - Name of the authorization methods.
  One of `advanced-rest-client/auth-methods`.
- queryModel (`Array<Object>`) - Query parameters data view model.
- pathModel (`Array<Object>`) - URI parameters data view model
- headersModel (`Array<Object>`) - Headers data view model

Do not change `queryModel`, `pathModel` and `headersModel` as it would
make it out of sync with the application and any change won't be
reflected in the editor. In future release this may be read only object.

## abort-api-request event

The event is dispatched when the user press `abort` button.
The transport must send `api-response` custom event with error message
so the state of the UI is updated.

The event contains the following properties:

- url (`String`) The request URL. Can be empty string. Also, it may be
different URL that the one used to send the request if the user changed
it in between. Use the `id` property to compare requests.
- id (`String`)  Generated UUID of the request with `api-request` event.

## api-response event

This element does not act on this event. See `api-request-panel`
documentation for more information.

## Styling

`<api-request-editor>` provides the following custom properties and
mixins for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--api-request-editor` | Mixin applied to this elment | `{}`
`--api-request-editor-container` | Mixin applied to the main container | `{}`
`--warning-primary-color` | Theme property, warning primary color | `#FF7043`
`--arc-font-body1` | Theme mixin, default font definition | `{}`
`--error-color` | Theme variable, error color.  | ``
`--api-request-editor-editors-border-color | Border color of editors in tabs | `transparent`
`--primary-button-background-color` | Theme property, background color of the primary action button. Applied to "send" and "abort" buttons | `--accent-color`
`--primary-button-color` | Theme property, font color of the primary action button. Applied to "send" and "abort" buttons  | `#fff`
`--action-button` | Theme mixin, applied to "send" and "abort" buttons | `{}`
`--primary-button-hover-background-color` | Theme property, background color of the primary action button when hovering. Applied to "send" and "abort" buttons | `--accent-color`
`--primary-button-hover-color` | Theme property, font color of the primary action button when hovering. Applied to "send" and "abort" buttons  | `#fff`
`--action-button-hover` | Theme mixin, applied to "send" and "abort" buttons when hovering | `{}`
`--primary-button-disabled-background-color` | Theme property, background color of the primary action button when disabled. Applied to "send" and "abort" buttons | `--accent-color`
`--primary-button-disabled-color` | Theme property, font color of the primary action button when disabled. Applied to "send" and "abort" buttons  | `#fff`
`--action-button-disabled` | Theme mixin, applied to "send" and "abort" buttons when disabled | `{}`
`--api-request-editor-container-narrow` | Mixin applied to the main container when `narrow` property is set. | `{}`
`--api-request-editor-send-valid-button` | Mixin applied to the send button when request is valid | `{}`
`--api-request-editor-send-invalid-button` | Mixin applied to the send button when request is invalid | `{}`
`--api-request-editor-abort-button` | Mixin applied to the abort button | `{}`

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: amfModel
properties.description:
AMF API model.
The element extracts method definition from passed model
and by using `selected`.

properties.name: ns
properties.description: A namespace for AMF model

properties.name: aware
properties.description: `raml-aware` scope property to use.

properties.name: selected
properties.description:
An `@id` of selected AMF shape. When changed it computes
method model for the selection.

properties.name: _methodModel
properties.description: Computed method declaration in the AMF model.

properties.name: noUrlEditor
properties.description:
Hides the URL editor from the view.
The editor is still in the DOM and the `urlInvalid` property still will be set.

properties.name: baseUri
properties.description:
A base URI for the API. To be set if RAML spec is missing `baseUri`
declaration and this produces invalid URL input. This information
is passed to the URL editor that prefixes the URL with `baseUri` value
if passed URL is a relative URL.

properties.name: httpMethod
properties.description: Computed from AMF model for the metod HTTP method name.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: Headers for the request.

properties.name: payload
properties.description:
Body for the request. The type of the body depends on
defined in the API media type.

properties.name: url
properties.description:
Final request URL including settings like `baseUri`, AMF
model settings and user provided parameters.
This value is always compoted by `api-url-editor` even if it's
hidden from the view.

properties.name: selectedTab
properties.description: Selected request tab.

properties.name: contentType
properties.description: Current content type.

properties.name: securedBy
properties.description: Computed value of security scheme from selected method.

properties.name: apiHeaders
properties.description: Computed list of headers in the AMF model

properties.name: apiPayload
properties.description: Defined by the API payload data.

properties.name: isPayloadRequest
properties.description: Computed value if the method can carry a payload.

properties.name: redirectUri
properties.description:
OAuth2 redirect URI.
This value **must** be set in order for OAuth 1/2 to work properly.

properties.name: authRequired
properties.description:
Inheritet from the authorization panel state if authorization is
required. Authorization may be not required if one of the
authorization methods is `nil` (RAML).

properties.name: authValid
properties.description:
Inheritet from the authorization panel state if authorization
data is valid.

properties.name: narrow
properties.description: If set it will renders the view in the narrow layout.

properties.name: authNotRequired
properties.description:
Computed value of if authorization is required for the endpoint.
If the auth is not required then the authorization tab is removed
from the view.

properties.name: loadingRequest
properties.description: Flag set when the request is being made.

properties.name: allowHideOptional
properties.description:
If set it computes `hasOptional` property and shows checkbox in the
form to show / hide optional properties.

properties.name: allowDisableParams
properties.description:
If set, enable / disable param checkbox is rendered next to each
form item.

properties.name: allowCustom
properties.description:
When set, renders "add custom" item button.
If the element is to be used withouth AMF model this should always
be enabled. Otherwise users won't be able to add a parameter.

properties.name: authMethod
properties.description: Selected by the user auth method (if any)

properties.name: authSettings
properties.description: Current authorization settings.

properties.name: requestId
properties.description:
Generated request ID when the request is sent. This value is reported
in send and abort events

properties.name: queryModel
properties.description: Request query parameters view model

properties.name: pathModel
properties.description: Request path parameters view model

properties.name: paramsInvalid
properties.description: Computed when URL params editor is invalid.

properties.name: headersInvalid
properties.description: Computed when headers editor is invalid.

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: _ensureAmfModel
methods.description: Ensures that the model is AMF object.

methods.name: _getValue
methods.description: Gets a signle scalar value from a model.

params.name: model
params.description: Amf model to extract the value from.

params.name: key
params.description: Model key to search for the value

methods.name: _getValueArray
methods.description: Gets values from a model as an array of `@value` properties.

params.name: model
params.description: Amf model to extract the value from.

params.name: key
params.description: Model key to search for the value

methods.name: _hasType
methods.description: Checks if a model has a type.

return.desc: True if model has a type.

methods.name: _hasProperty
methods.description: Checks if a shape has a property.

methods.name: _computePropertyArray
methods.description: Computes array value of a property in a model (shape).

methods.name: _computePropertyObject
methods.description:
Computes a value of a property in a model (shape).
It takes first value of a property, if exists.

methods.name: _computeHasStringValue
methods.description: Tests if a passed argumet exists.

methods.name: _computeHasArrayValue
methods.description:
Computes if passed argument is an array and has a value.
It does not check for type or value of the array items.

methods.name: _computeDescription
methods.description: Computes description for a shape.

methods.name: _computeHeaders
methods.description: Computes model definition for headers.

methods.name: _computeServerVariables
methods.description: Computes value for `serverVariables` property.

methods.name: _computeEndpointVariables
methods.description: Computes value for `endpointVariables` property.

methods.name: _computePayload
methods.description: Computes value for the `payload` property

methods.name: _computeReturns
methods.description: Computes value for `returns` property

methods.name: _computeSecurity
methods.description: Computes value for `security` property

methods.name: _computeHasCustomProperties
methods.description: Computes value for `hasCustomProperties` property.

methods.name: _computeEncodes
methods.description: Computes model's `encodes` property.

methods.name: _computeDeclares
methods.description: Computes list of declarations in the AMF api model.

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeReferences
methods.description: Computes list of references in the AMF api model.

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeWebApi
methods.description: Computes AMF's `http://schema.org/WebAPI` model

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeServer
methods.description: Computes value for `server` property that is later used with other computations.

methods.name: _computeEndpointUri
methods.description: Computes endpoint's URI based on `amfModel` and `endpoint` models.

methods.name: _getBaseUri
methods.description:
Computes base URI value from either `baseUri`, `iron-meta` with
`ApiBaseUri` key or `amfModel` value (in this order).

return.desc: Base uri value. Can be empty string.

methods.name: _getAmfBaseUri
methods.description: Computes base URI from AMF model.

params.name: protocols
params.description:
Listy of supporte dprotocols. If not
provided and required to compute the url it uses `amfModel` to compute
protocols

methods.name: _ensureUrlScheme
methods.description:
A function that makes sure that the URL has a scheme definition.
If no supported protocols information is available it assumes `http`.

params.name: protocols
params.description:
List of supported by the API protocols
An array of string like: `['HTTP', 'HTTPS']`. It lowercase the value.
If not set it tries to read supported protocols value from `amfModel`
property.

methods.name: _computeProtocols
methods.description: Computes supported protocols by the API.

methods.name: _computeExpects
methods.description: Computes value for the `expects` property.

methods.name: _computePropertyValue
methods.description:
Tries to find an example value (whether it's default value or from an
example) to put it into snippet's values.

methods.name: _computeEndpointModel
methods.description: Computes model for an endpoint documentation.

methods.name: _computeMethodModel
methods.description: Computes method model from the AMF model

params.name: api
params.description: The AMF model for the API.

methods.name: _computeType
methods.description: Computes a type documentation model.

methods.name: _computeSecurityModel
methods.description: Computes model for selected security definition.

methods.name: _computeDocument
methods.description: Computes a documentation model.

methods.name: _resolve
methods.description: Resolves a reference to an external fragment.

methods.name: _getExampleValue
methods.description: Gets string value for an example data model.

params.name: isJson
params.description:
If set it checks if the `raw` value is valid JSON.
If it isn't then it parses structured value.

methods.name: _computeExampleFromStructuredValue
methods.description: Computes an example from example structured value.

return.desc: Javascript object or array with structured value.

methods.name: _computeStructuredExampleValue
methods.description: Computes value with propert data type for a structured example.

methods.name: clearRequest
methods.description: Clears the request properties.

methods.name: _computeFinalBaseUri
methods.description: Computes base URI passed to the URL editor.

params.name: customBaseUri
params.description: Base URI that overrides api base uri

methods.name: computeEndpointId
methods.description:
Computes endpoint `@id` for given `id`.
On a base level it subrtacts the last part after `/` which
is a delimiter between endpoint identifier and method name.

params.name: id
params.description: Object ID. Can be operation's or endpoint's ID.

return.desc:
Endpoint id. It may return the same value if passed
id is endpoint ID.

methods.name: findEndpoint
methods.description: Finds an endpoint definition in the API.

params.name: api
params.description:
AMD model for the api. If not set, `webApi` property
is used.

methods.name: findMethod
methods.description: Finds a method definition on the list of operations for an endpoint.

methods.name: _computeSecuredBy
methods.description: Computes AMF model for authorization panel.

return.desc: List of security definitions for the endpoint.

methods.name: _computeNoAuth
methods.description: Computes if authorization for the endpoint is set.

methods.name: _computeHttpMethod
methods.description:
Computes value for `httpMethod` property from AMF model for current
operation.

methods.name: _computeApiPayload
methods.description:
Computes value for `apiPayload` property from AMF model for current
method.

methods.name: _computeIsPayloadRequest
methods.description:
Computes value for `isPayloadRequest`.
Only `GET` and `HEAD` methods are known as ones that can't carry a
payload. For any other HTTP method this always returns true.

methods.name: _noAuthChanged
methods.description:
Updates tabs selection when `authNotRequired` property change.
It changes selection to the next tab if there's no authorization
and current selected editor is authorization.

methods.name: _selectedTabChanged
methods.description:
Updates the state of the body editor when switching to it.
Code mirror does not property calculate it's value when
the editor is not visible. This forces to refresh the value of the
editor.

methods.name: _isPayloadChanged
methods.description: Refreshes tabs selection when `isPayloadRequest` peroperty chnage.

methods.name: _refreshTabs
methods.description: Refreshes tabs selection. To be called when number of tabs changes.

methods.name: _analyticsEvent
methods.description: Dispatches analytics event.

methods.name: authAndExecute
methods.description:
To be called when the user want to execute the request but
authorization is invalid (missin values).
This function brings the auth panel to front and displays error toast

TODO: There is a case when the user didn't requested OAuth2 token
but provided all the data. This function should check for this
condition and call authorization function automatically.

methods.name: execute
methods.description:
Executes the request by dispatching `api-request` custom event.
The event must be handled by hosting application to ensure transport.
Use `advanced-rest-client/xhr-simple-request` component to add logic
that uses XHR as a transport.

Hosting application also must reset state of `loadingRequest` property
once the response is ready. It also can dispatch `api-response`
custom event handled by this element to reset state. This is also
handled by `xhr-simple-request` component.

methods.name: _abortRequest
methods.description:
Sends the `abort-api-request` custom event to cancel the request.
Calling this method befor sending request may have unexpected
behavior because `requestId` is only set with `execute()` method.

methods.name: serializeRequest
methods.description:
Returns an object with the request properties.
The object contains:
- `method` (String)
- `url` (String)
- `headers` (String)
- `payload` (String)
- `auth` (Object)

The `auth` property is optional and is only added to the request if
simple `authorization` header will not work. For example NTLM auth
method has to be made on a single socket connection (authorization
and the request) so it can't be made before the request.

The `auth` object contains 2 properties:
- `type` (String) the authorization type - one of from the
`auth-methods` element
- `settings` (Object) Authorization parameters entered by the user.
It vary and depends on selected auth method.
For example in case of the NTLM it will be: `username`, `password` and
`domain`. See `advanced-rest-client/auth-methods` for model descriptions.

methods.name: _authSettingsChanged
methods.description:
Handler for the `authorization-settings-changed` dispatched by
authorization panel. Sets auth settings and executes the request if
any pending if valid.

methods.name: _responseHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the `api-response` custom event.
Clears the loading state.

methods.name: _authRedirectChangedHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the `oauth2-redirect-uri-changed` custom event. Changes
the `redirectUri` property.

methods.name: _urlChanged
methods.description: Dispatches `url-value-changed` event when url value change.

elements.name: ApiRequestEditor

attributes.name: events-target
attributes.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

attributes.name: amf-model
attributes.description:
AMF API model.
The element extracts method definition from passed model
and by using `selected`.

attributes.name: ns
attributes.description: A namespace for AMF model

attributes.name: aware
attributes.description: `raml-aware` scope property to use.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
An `@id` of selected AMF shape. When changed it computes
method model for the selection.

attributes.name: no-url-editor
attributes.description:
Hides the URL editor from the view.
The editor is still in the DOM and the `urlInvalid` property still will be set.

attributes.name: base-uri
attributes.description:
A base URI for the API. To be set if RAML spec is missing `baseUri`
declaration and this produces invalid URL input. This information
is passed to the URL editor that prefixes the URL with `baseUri` value
if passed URL is a relative URL.

attributes.name: http-method
attributes.description: Computed from AMF model for the metod HTTP method name.

attributes.name: headers
attributes.description: Headers for the request.

attributes.name: payload
attributes.description:
Body for the request. The type of the body depends on
defined in the API media type.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description:
Final request URL including settings like `baseUri`, AMF
model settings and user provided parameters.
This value is always compoted by `api-url-editor` even if it's
hidden from the view.

attributes.name: selected-tab
attributes.description: Selected request tab.

attributes.name: content-type
attributes.description: Current content type.

attributes.name: secured-by
attributes.description: Computed value of security scheme from selected method.

attributes.name: api-headers
attributes.description: Computed list of headers in the AMF model

attributes.name: api-payload
attributes.description: Defined by the API payload data.

attributes.name: is-payload-request
attributes.description: Computed value if the method can carry a payload.

attributes.name: redirect-uri
attributes.description:
OAuth2 redirect URI.
This value **must** be set in order for OAuth 1/2 to work properly.

attributes.name: auth-required
attributes.description:
Inheritet from the authorization panel state if authorization is
required. Authorization may be not required if one of the
authorization methods is `nil` (RAML).

attributes.name: auth-valid
attributes.description:
Inheritet from the authorization panel state if authorization
data is valid.

attributes.name: narrow
attributes.description: If set it will renders the view in the narrow layout.

attributes.name: auth-not-required
attributes.description:
Computed value of if authorization is required for the endpoint.
If the auth is not required then the authorization tab is removed
from the view.

attributes.name: loading-request
attributes.description: Flag set when the request is being made.

attributes.name: allow-hide-optional
attributes.description:
If set it computes `hasOptional` property and shows checkbox in the
form to show / hide optional properties.

attributes.name: allow-disable-params
attributes.description:
If set, enable / disable param checkbox is rendered next to each
form item.

attributes.name: allow-custom
attributes.description:
When set, renders "add custom" item button.
If the element is to be used withouth AMF model this should always
be enabled. Otherwise users won't be able to add a parameter.

attributes.name: auth-method
attributes.description: Selected by the user auth method (if any)

attributes.name: auth-settings
attributes.description: Current authorization settings.

attributes.name: request-id
attributes.description:
Generated request ID when the request is sent. This value is reported
in send and abort events

attributes.name: query-model
attributes.description: Request query parameters view model

attributes.name: path-model
attributes.description: Request path parameters view model

attributes.name: params-invalid
attributes.description: Computed when URL params editor is invalid.

attributes.name: headers-invalid
attributes.description: Computed when headers editor is invalid.

events.name: abort-api-request
events.description:
Fired when the user requests to abort current request.

This event can be cancelled.

events.name: api-request
events.description:
Dispatched when the user requests to send current request.

This event can be cancelled.

events.name: request-path-model-changed
events.description: Dispatched when path variables model changed.
